column5: Mine are pretty simple... Eat a bit better for my health And enjoy life a bit more with my Kids this year (so in other words...work less, play more)  That and catch a bunch more fish!

Hmm,  let me see ...  lose another 20-25 lbs (i've lost 23 since october). Spend more time with the family, take my kids fishing more (now that the youngest is 4). Fish more and meet up with more OFNCers when possible. Try and stay healthy.  Wishing you all a healthy and prosperous New Year!  Stan
lets see about, 1989 I made 2 Resolutions  1. to quit smoking  2. to never make another new years resolution  to this day I have kept both of them
Hmm....  I guess my goal is to keep up my exercise regime (which I have been lax on over the holidays) so I can stay off the blood pressure pills and feel better...
Mine is to be a kinder gentler GCD in 2008.
Dawg, they're a lot easier to keep if you stick to something realistic and attainable.
Thats funny Roy - I was just thinking the exact same thing!!  lol   Don
Hmmmm....  1) Quit Smoking 2) Be the best dad I can be for my daughter that will be joining me in April 3) Learn to tie a blood knot
LOL.. umm some days.. you have NO idea....

1. Get this house finished off inside so I can sell it in the next couple years. 2. Spend more time in the shop getting work done. 3. Spend less time on this electronic box. 4. Start drinking again...my 10 year liver reprieve is up in 4 days !  Not necessarily in that order!
Lose weight and start to exercise my goal is 40 pounds by May.
To have a reason to change the name of my boat, which is currently named Quest for 50"...
